questions: ______ has dominion over a man as long as he lives?
A woman is bound by _____ to her ______ while he lives.
______ is called an adulteress?
answer: A woman who marries another man while her husband still lives. Rom7:3.

questions: How do we become dead to the law?
answer: Through the body of Christ. Rom 7:4.

questions: What kind of fruit did the sinful passion which was aroused by the law in our members produce?
What was the shape of the door posts of the temple?
There is no authority except from __________. Fill in the gap.
What garment shall the priests put on while they minister within the gates of the inner court or within the house?
The priests shall have ____ on their heads while they minister within the gates of the inner court or within the house.
The authorities that exist are appointed by who?
In Ezekiel 31, which nation is compared to a cedar in Lebanon?
What was the cause of the downfall of the great tree representing Assyria in Ezekiel 31?
What happened to the tree's branches and roots when it was brought down?
answer: The branches were broken and the roots were scattered by the rivers, and all the nations of the earth went away from its shade and left it (Ezekiel 31:12).

questions: Who is the 'great monster' in Ezekiel 32:2, and what does it symbolize?
answer: Pharaoh, king of Egypt, symbolizing Egypt's power (Ezekiel 32:2)

questions: According to Ezekiel 32, where would Pharaoh and his multitude be cast after their fall?
answer: Into the Pit, among the uncircumcised, with those who have fallen by the sword (Ezekiel 32:18-19)

questions: Who was the father of Jaazaniah?

Ezekiel saw the vision of a likeness of man. From the waist downwards, like the appearance of _______ and from the waist upwards, like the appearance of brightness, like the colour of amber. Fill in the gap.
The seat of which image was at the door of the north gate of the inner court?
In the inner court of the temple, were about twenty-five men with their faces towards the east. What were they worshipping?
Whenever you judge another, what do you do to yourself?
Fill in the gaps “Then the ________ lifted me up and brought me to the ______ Gate of the Lord’s house,…”
Fill in the gaps “ Now it happened, while I was prophesying, that ______ the son of _____ died.
Fill in the gaps, Therefore say, ‘Thus says the Lord God: “I will gather you from the peoples, assemble you from the _________ where you have been scattered, and I will give you the land of ________.
Fill in the gaps, Then the ________ took me up and brought me in a vision by the Spirit of God into _________, to those in captivity. And the vision that I had seen went up from me.

Fill in the gaps, But I will spare a few of their men from the sword, from ______, and from _______, that they may declare all their abominations among the Gentiles wherever they go. Then they shall know that I am the Lord.”
How did Paul know sin according to Romans 7:7
How did Paul answer this question "Is the law sin"?
What produces all manner of evil desires?
Complete this verse according to Romans 7:19 For the good that I will to do, I do not do; but the evil I will not to do, ______
Quote Romans 8:1
answer: There is therefore now no condemnation to those who are in Christ Jesus, who do not walk according to the flesh, but according to the Spirit. Rom 8:1.

questions: The law of the Spirit of life in Christ Jesus has made me free from the law of ____and ____.
What the law could not do because of it's weakness, God did it by ______.
answer: God did by sending His own Son in the likeness of sinful flesh. Rom 8:3.

questions: According to Romans 8:5, What is the way of life of those who live according to the flesh?
answer: They set their minds on things of the flesh. Rom 8:5.

questions: To be spiritually minded is ___ and ____.
According to Romans 8:7, ______ is an enmity against God?
Those who resist the authority and ordinance of God will bring what on themselves?
You must be subject to those in authority, not only because of wrath, but also for what sake?
What was the measurement used to separate the holy areas from the common?
answer: 500 cubits long and 500 cubits wide. Ezekiel 42:20.

questions: Complete this statement: For if we live, we live to the Lord; and if we die, we die to the Lord. Therefore, whether we live or die, ___________ .
For the kingdom of God is not eating and drinking but what?
answer: Righteous, and Peace and Joy in the Holy Spirit. Romans 14:17.

questions: What day shall the priests offer their burnt offerings and their peace offerings on the altar to the Lord?
The priests shall neither shave their heads nor let their hair grow long, but they shall keep their hair in what shape?
No priest shall drink ___________ when he enters the inner court?
Rulers are not a terror to good works, but are terror to what?
The priests shall not eat anything, ______________ or ______________ , that died naturally or was torn by wild beasts. Fill in the gaps.
What nations does Ezekiel 32 mention as lying in the pit alongside Egypt?
answer: Ans: Assyria, Elam, Meshech, Tubal, Edom, and the princes of the north (Ezekiel 32:22-30).

questions: In Ezekiel 33, what role is the prophet compared to, and what is his responsibility?
answer: A watchman, responsible for warning the people (Ezekiel 33:7).

questions: What does God say will happen if the watchman fails to warn the people?
answer: The wicked will die for their sins, but their blood will be on the watchman's hands (Ezekiel 33:6).

questions: What message does Ezekiel bring to the people of Israel in Ezekiel 33:11?
answer: I take no pleasure in the death of the wicked, but rather that they turn from their ways and live" (Ezekiel 33:11).

questions: Who does God hold accountable for the scattering of His flock in Ezekiel 34?
answer: The shepherds of Israel, for failing to care for the flock (Ezekiel 34:2-6).

questions: What promise does God make regarding His flock in Ezekiel 34:11-12?
answer: God Himself will search for His sheep and look after them (Ezekiel 34:11-12).

questions: Who is the 'one shepherd' God promises to set over His flock in Ezekiel 34:23?
Against which nation is the prophecy in Ezekiel 35 directed?
Why does God pronounce judgment against Edom in Ezekiel 35?
answer: Because of their perpetual hostility and bloodshed against Israel (Ezekiel 35:5)

questions: What does God say will happen to Mount Seir and its cities in Ezekiel 35:9?
answer: What does God say will happen to Mount Seir and its cities in Ezekiel 35:9?

questions: There is no partiality with __________?
For as many who have sinned in the law will be judged by what?
How many men came from the direction of the upper gate facing the north?
What were the men from the direction of the upper gate facing the north, holding in their hands?
What was the Lord’s first instruction to the man clothed with linen, who had the writer’s inkhorn at his side?
answer: The Lord asked him to go through the midst of the city of Jerusalem and put a mark on the foreheads of the men who sigh and cry over all the abominations that are done within it. Ezekiel 9:3-4.

questions: Circumcision is indeed profitable if you do what?
Where did the Lord ask the men to begin the killings (slaying of the people)?
If you are a breaker of the law, your circumcision has become___________
Who are the ones the Lord asked the man clothed with Linen and the other men to spare (Not to come near)?
answer: Anyone who had the mark on them. Ezekiel 9:3-6.

questions: What appeared in the firmament that was above the head of the cherubim?
answer: Something like a sapphire stone. Ezekiel 10:1.

questions: In Eze12:19, Who was God referring to when he said “They shall eat their bread with anxiety, and drink their water with dread, so that her land may be emptied of all who are in it, because of the violence of all those who dwell in it…”
answer: The inhabitants of Jerusalem, the land of Israel. Eze12:19.

questions: Fill in the gaps, Thus says the Lord God: “Woe to the foolish prophets, who follow their own _______ and have seen _______!
Fill in the gaps, O Israel, your prophets are like ________ in the _________.
Fill in the gaps, They have envisioned _________ and __________________, saying, ‘Thus says the Lord!’ But the Lord has not sent them; yet they hope that the word may be confirmed.

Fill in the gaps, “Son of man, these men have set up their ______ in their hearts, and put before them that which causes them to stumble into _______. Should I let Myself be inquired of at all by them?

When the word of the Lord came unto Ezekiel in the book of Ezekiel14:14, he mentioned the names of three men in the Bible and said they would deliver only themselves by their righteousness. What are the names of the three men?
For thus says the Lord God: “How much more it shall be when I send My four severe judgments on Jerusalem...” What are the four severe judgements the Lord was referring to here?
answer: the sword and famine and wild beasts and pestilence. Eze14:21.

questions: In Ezekiel Chapter 15, when the Lord spoke through Ezekiel unto Jerusalem likening it to the wood of the vine among the trees in the forest which is thrown into the fire for fuel. What reason did the Lord give for making their land desolate?
answer: It is because they have persisted in unfaithfulness,’ says the Lord God. Eze15:8.

questions: Fill in the gaps, ‘Thus says the Lord God to Jerusalem: “Your birth and your nativity are from the land of Canaan; your father was an ________ and your mother a ________.
Fill in the gaps, “Your fame went out among the nations because of your ________, for it was perfect through My _________ which I had bestowed on you,” says the Lord God.
According to Rom 8:8, Who are those that cannot please God?
answer: Those who are in the flesh. Rom 8:8.

questions: Romans 8: 11 But if the Spirit of Him who raised Jesus from the dead dwells in you, He who raised Christ from the dead ____________through His Spirit who dwells in you. Complete the sentence.
answer: Will also give life to your mortal bodies. Rom 8:11.

questions: How do we live according to Romans 8:13?
answer: Putting to death the deeds of the body by the Spirit

questions: Quote Romans 8:14.
answer: For as many as are led by the Spirit of God, these are sons of God. Rom 8:14.

questions: Complete this verse: For you did not receive the spirit of bondage again to fear, but you received the Spirit of adoption by whom we cry out, __________. Complete this statement.
But the _________ bears witness with our spirit that we are children of God. Complete this statement.
According to Apostle Paul, what is not worthy to be compared with the glory which shall be revealed in us according to Romans 8:18
answer: The sufferings of this present time. Rom 8:18.

questions: Quote Romans 8:19.
answer: For the earnest expectation of the creation eagerly waits for the revealing of the sons of God.

questions: According to Rom 8:20, the _______ was subjected to futility. Complete this statement.
Complete this verse, Romans 8:28, “And we know that all things work together for good to those who love God, ________________.
answer: To those who are the called according to His purpose. Rom 8:28.

questions: Who was God referring to in this verse Ezekiel 21:3, Thus says the Lord: "Behold, I am against you, and I will draw My sword out of its sheath and cut off both righteous and wicked from you.
According to Ezekiel 21:21, which king stands at the parting of the road?

Fill in the gap according to Ezekiel 22:20, “As men gather silver, bronze, iron, ___, and ____ into the midst of a furnace, to blow fire on it, to melt it; so I will gather you in My anger and in My fury, and I will leave you there and melt you”.
Fill in the gap, As silver is melted in the midst of a furnace, so shall you be _______ in its midst; then you shall know that I, the Lord, have poured out My fury on you.' "
According to Ezekiel 22:30, Did God find a man to stand in the gap before Him for the Land?
answer: No, he found no one. Eze 22:30.

questions: What day and what month should the seven days Passover feast be observed?
answer: On the fourteenth day of the first month. Ezekiel 45:21.

questions: On the fourteenth day of the first month. Ezekiel 45:21.
The gateway of the inner court that faces towards the east shall be shut for how many working days of the week?
answer: Six working days of the week. Ezekiel 46:1.

questions: All commandments are summed up in this statement: which is?
answer: You shall love your neighbour as yourself”. Romans 13:9(b).

questions: But he who doubts is condemned if he eats, because he does not eat from faith: For whatever is not from faith is __________.
How many days shall be counted for a priest who defiles himself, after cleansing, before he can minister in the sanctuary?
Why was the outer gate of the sanctuary which faces the east shut, that no man shall enter through it?
answer: Because the Lord God of Israel has entered by it. Ezekiel 44:2.

questions: What makes up the burnt offering that the Prince offers to the Lord on the Sabbath day?
answer: Six Lambs without blemish, and a Ram without blemish. Ezekiel 46:4.

questions: What makes up the burnt offering that the Prince offers to the Lord on the day of the new moon?
answer: A young bull without blemish, six Lambs, and a Ram, all without blemish. Ezekiel 46:6.

questions: Whatever things were written before, were written for our learning. True or False?
Where do the people of the land worship the Lord on Sabbath days and on the days of the new moon?
answer: At the entrance to the gateway. Ezekiel 46:3.

questions: The strong ones should bear with the scruples of the weak, and not to please themselves. True or False?
What is the name of the servant of God of the church in Cenchrea, commended by Apostle Paul?
According to Romans 16, Apostle Paul sent greetings to his two fellow workers in Christ, they risked their own necks for his life. Mention their names?
“They will bear fruit every month, because their water flows from the sanctuary. Their fruit will be for __________, and their leaves for _________ ’. Fill in the gaps.
Against which mountain does the Lord speak in Ezekiel 35?
What reason does God give for His judgment against Mount Seir?
answer: Because of its perpetual enmity and the shedding of blood of the people of Israel. (Ezekiel 35:3).

questions: According to Ezekiel 35:3, What does God promise to do to Mount Seir as part of His judgment?
answer: He will make it desolate, Eze 35:3.

questions: In Ezekiel 36, what does God promise to do for the mountains of Israel?
answer: To bless them and make them fruitful. Eze 36.

questions: What will happen to the land of Israel, according to God's promise in Ezekiel 36?
answer: The land will be restored, inhabited, and will flourish. Eze 36.

questions: What does God say He will remove from the people of Israel?
answer: Their heart of stone and give them a heart of flesh. Eze 36:26.

questions: What is the purpose of God’s restoration of Israel according to Ezekiel 36:23?
answer: To sanctify His great name among the nations. Eze 36:23.

questions: What happens to the dry bones when Ezekiel prophesies over them?
answer: They come together bone to bone, the sinews and flesh came upon them, and they received the breath of life and lived an exceedingly great army. Eze 37:4-9.

questions: What does the vision of the dry bones represent?
What purpose does God’s judgment on Gog serve according to Ezekiel 38:23?
answer: To show His greatness and holiness and make Himself known in the eyes of many nations. Eze 38:23.

questions: What will be the fate of Gog’s army according to Ezekiel 39?
answer: They will fall on the mountains of Israel, and their bodies will be devoured by birds and beasts. Eze 39:4.

questions: How long will it take to bury the bodies of Gog’s army?
What will be the result of God’s judgment on Gog and the nations according to Ezekiel 39:21-22?
answer: The house of Israel will know that the Lord is their God, and the nations will know that Israel went into captivity for their iniquity. Eze 39:22-23.

questions: In Ezekiel 40, what does Ezekiel see in his vision?
answer: A vision of the new temple.

questions: What is the first structure described in the temple vision in Ezekiel 40?
answer: The eastern gate of the temple. Eze 40:10.

questions: What appearance does the sapphire stone that appeared in the firmament have?
answer: The appearance of the likeness of a throne. Ezekiel 10:1(b).

questions: Complete this statement: As it is written: “There is none righteous, __________?
When the Cherubim appeared, what were they having under their wings?
answer: The form of a man's hand. Ezekiel 10:8

questions: Quote Romans 3:23?
answer: For all have sinned and fall short of the glory of God. Romans 3:23.

questions: According to Ezekiel chapter 10, each wheel had how many faces?
According to Ezekiel chapter 10, The first face was the face of a _________?
According to Ezekiel chapter 10, The second face was the face of a ________?
According to Ezekiel chapter 10, The third face was the face of a __________?
According to Ezekiel chapter 10, What was the fourth face of the wheel?
Ezekiel had the vision of the Cherubim by the River ________?
Who wrote the epistle (the book of Romans) to the saints in Rome?
Our Lord, Jesus Christ was born of the seed of _______ according to the flesh.
The gospel of Christ is the power of God to __________ for everyone who believes.
In what is the righteousness of God revealed from faith to faith?
answer: In the gospel of Christ. Romans 1:16-17(a).

questions: Complete this statement. As it is written, “The just shall live by _______ .”

Fill in the gaps, “Thus says the Lord God: “Because your __________ was poured out and your ________ uncovered in your harlotry with your lovers, and with all your abominable idols, and because of the blood of your children which you gave to them,
Fill in the gaps, “Your elder sister is ________, who dwells with her daughters to the north of you; and your younger sister, who dwells to the south of you, is ________ and her daughters.
Fill in the gap, “Son of man, pose a ________, and speak a _______ to the house of Israel,”
Fill in the gap, “What do you mean when you use this proverb concerning the land of Israel, saying: ‘The fathers have eaten sour ________, And the children’s teeth are set on ______’?

Fill in the gaps, “Yet you say, ‘Why should the son not bear the guilt of the father?’ Because the son has done what is ________ and right, and has kept all My _________ and observed them, he shall surely live.
Complete the sentence, For I have no pleasure in the death of one who dies,” says the Lord God. _____________________________.
In Ezekiel 19, the lamentation of the lioness and her cub was against who?
Complete the sentence, Fire has come out from a rod of her branches and devoured her fruit, So that she has no strong branch ______________________________________.’
Fill in the gaps, “It came to pass in the ________ year, in the ________ month, on the tenth day of the month that certain of the elders of Israel came to inquire of the Lord, and sat before me.
Fill in the gaps, “All flesh shall see that I, the Lord, have ________ it; it shall not be ________.”
Fill in the gaps, “Now to him who works, the wages are not counted as _______ but as _______.
Complete the statement, “Blessed are those whose lawless deeds are forgiven, ______________________________.
answer: And whose sins are covered; Rom4:7.

questions: Fill in the gaps, “He did not waver at the promise of God through ___________, but was ____________ in faith, giving glory to God”
Fill in the gaps, Therefore, having been __________ by faith, we have ________ with God through our Lord Jesus Christ,…
According to Rom5:3-4, which says “And not only that, but we also glory tribulations, knowing that tribulation produces ___________________. Mention the three virtues tribulation produces.
Two sisters were mentioned in the opening verse of Ezekiel chapter 23, Mention their names.
_____ was the elder sister in Ezekiel 23:4.
According to Ezekiel 23:4, Samaria is _____ and Jerusalem is _____.
answer: Samaria is Oholah and Jerusalem is Oholibah. Eze 23:4.

questions: Which of the two sisters in Ezekiel 23, committed more crime?
Ezekiel 23:31, You have walked in the way of your _______; therefore I will put her cup in your hand.'
What was the instruction given to Ezekiel in Ezekiel 24:16 regarding the death of his wife?
answer: He should not mourn nor weep. Eze 24:16.

questions: Ezekiel 25:4 says “Indeed, therefore, I will deliver you as a possession to the men of the East, and they shall set their encampments among you and make their dwellings among you; they shall eat your fruit, and they shall drink your milk.” Who was the Lord referring to here according to Ezekiel 25:3?
Ezekiel 25:8 Thus says the Lord God: "Because _____ and _____ say, 'Look! The house of Judah is like all the nations,'
According to Ezekiel 26:3, The Lord said He's against which Nation?
Which nation said she's perfect in beauty according to Ezekiel 27:3?
Greetings was sent to Paul’s country men and fellow prisoners. Mention their names.
According to Romans 16, Apostle Paul urged the people of Rome to note and avoid some people, who are they?
answer: Those who cause division and offences, contrary to the doctrine which they learnt. Romans 16:17.

questions: Apostle Paul also urged the people of Rome to be wise in what is ______ and be simple concerning _______.
The gates of the city were named after the tribes of Israel. On the East Side, three gates were alloted to three tribes of Israel. Name them.
answer: One gate for Joseph, one gate for Benjamin and one gate for Dan. Ezekiel 48:32.

questions: The gates of the city were named after the tribes of Israel. The three gates northwards were alloted to three tribes of Israel. Mention them.
answer: One gate for Reuben, one gate for Judah and one gate for Levi. Ezekiel 48:31.

questions: What was the name of the treasurer of the city?
What was the name of the host of the whole church?
The gateway of the inner court that faces towards the east shall only be opened when?
answer: On the Sabbath and on the day of the new moon. Ezekiel 46:1.

questions: Who was the writer of the epistle to the people of Rome on behalf of Paul?
On the eighth day, the priests shall offer two offerings to the Lord on the altar. Mention them. Ans: Burnt offerings and peace offerings. Ezekiel 43:27.
answer: Burnt offerings and peace offerings. Ezekiel 43:27

questions: Who guides Ezekiel through the vision of the temple in Ezekiel 40?
answer: A man whose appearance was like bronze, holding a line of flax and a measuring rod. Eze 40:3.

questions: According to Romans 10:9, What must one do to be saved?
answer: Believe in Jesus' resurrection and confess Him as Lord. Romans 10:9.

questions: Romans 10:13 states, "For whosoever shall call upon the name of the Lord shall be saved." Which Old Testament prophet is this quotation attributed to?
In Romans 11:1, has God cast away His people?
According to Romans 11:5, there is a remnant according to the ___________________________. Complete the statement.
In Romans 11:25, what is the mystery concerning Israel?
answer: That blindness in part has happened to Israel until the fullness of the Gentiles has comes in.

questions: According to Romans 11:32, why has God concluded all to disobedience?
answer: That He might have mercy on all. Rom 11:32.

questions: In Romans 11:33, what does Paul say about the depth of God’s wisdom and knowledge?
answer: His judgements are unsearchable and His ways past finding out. Rom 11:33.

questions: What does Paul urge believers to present as a living sacrifice to God?
What should believers not conform to, according to Romans 12:2?
answer: Not be conformed to this world (Romans 12:2).

questions: For the wrath of God is revealed from heaven against all ungodliness and __________ of men. Fill in the gap.
Apostle Paul was ashamed to preach the gospel of Christ. True or False?

Now it came to pass in the thirtieth year, in the fourth month, on the fifth day of the month, as I was among the captives by the River Chebar, that the heavens were opened and I saw visions of God. Where can this be found?
In Ezekiel 1:2, what king was mentioned?
Ezekiel was the son of ____
Complete this verse, Ezekiel 1:6, Each one had _____, and each one had _______
answer: Four faces and four wings. Eze1:6.

questions: The living creatures mentioned in Ezekiel chapter 2 has ____ number of faces, name them
answer: 4, The face of a man, Lion, Eagle and Ox. Ezekiel 1:10.

questions: What colour was the The likeness of the firmament above the heads of the living creatures
According to Ezekiel 2:3, who was Ezekiel sent to and why?
answer: The children of Israel, A rebellious nationthat has rebelled against Me; they and their fathers have transgressed against Me to this very day. Eze2:3.

questions: Who was this statement addressed to and by whom,  "And you, son of man, do not be afraid of them nor be afraid of their words, though briers and thorns are with you and you dwell among scorpions; do not be afraid of their words or dismayed by their looks, though they are a rebellious house.
answer: To Ezekiel and by God. Ezekiel 2:6

questions: Fill in the gaps, “Now hope does not _________, because the love of God has been poured out in our hearts by the _________________ who was given to us.

Fill in the gaps, “Nevertheless death reigned from ________ to _________, even over those who had not sinned according to the likeness of the transgression of Adam, who is a type of Him who was to come.

Fill in the gaps, “Therefore, as through [h]one man’s offense judgment came to all men, resulting in ___________, even so through one[i] Man’s righteous act the free gift came to all men, resulting in _____________ of life.
Fill in the gaps, “For as by one man’s disobedience many were made _________, so also by one Man’s obedience many will be made _________.
Fill in the gaps, “Moreover the law entered that the offense might abound. But where ______ abounded, _______ abounded much more.
Quote Rom6:1-2 NKJV.
answer: What shall we say then? Shall we continue in sin that grace may abound? 2 Certainly not! How shall we who died to sin live any longer in it? Rom6:1-2 NKJV.

questions: Fill in the gaps, “For if we have been united together in the likeness of His _______, certainly we also shall be in the likeness of His _________.
Complete the sentence, “knowing this, that our old man was crucified with Him,that the body of sin might be done away with, that we should no ___________________________.
answer: longer be slaves of sin. Rom6:6.

questions: Complete the statement, “Therefore do not let sin ________________________, that you should obey it in its lusts.
answer: reign in your mortal body. Rom6:12.

questions: Fill in the gaps, “For sin shall not have _________ over you, for you are not under law but under _________.
